005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter.MetaschemaDataTypeProvider;
009
010import java.util.Collections;
011import java.util.LinkedList;
012import java.util.List;
013
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
015
016/**
017 * A base implementation of an {@link IDataTypeProvider}, supporting dynamic
018 * loading of Metaschema data type extensions at runtime.
019 * <p>
020 * The {@link MetaschemaDataTypeProvider} class provides an example of how to
021 * use this class to provide new data types.
022 */
023public abstract class AbstractDataTypeProvider implements IDataTypeProvider {
024  private final List<IDataTypeAdapter<?>> library = new LinkedList<>();
025
026  @SuppressWarnings("null")
027  @Override
028  public List<? extends IDataTypeAdapter<?>> getJavaTypeAdapters() {
029    synchronized (this) {
030      return Collections.unmodifiableList(library);
031    }
032  }
033
034  /**
035   * Register the provided {@code adapter} with the type system.
036   *
037   * @param adapter
038   *          the adapter to register
039   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
040   *           if another type adapter has no name
041   */
042  protected void registerDatatype(@NonNull IDataTypeAdapter<?> adapter) {
043    if (adapter.getNames().isEmpty()) {
044      throw new IllegalArgumentException("The adapter has no name: " + adapter.getClass().getName());
045    }
046    synchronized (this) {
047      library.add(adapter);
048    }
049  }
050}
